definition: hand in hand
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: " She gestured to a middle-aged couple holding hands. "Look at them.
sentences.chinese: 她指着一對手牽手的中年夫婦，“看看他們。

sentences.english: Heartbeat by heartbeat, hand by hand, we'll build a new era.
sentences.chinese: 心連心，手牽手，我們一定能夠創造新的時代。

sentences.english: The prince apparently held hands with his fiancée as they walked slowly to the island where Princess Diana was laid to rest.
sentences.chinese: 王子與凱特手牽手，慢慢來到黛安娜王妃長眠的小島。

sentences.english: Sloan: Last I heard you were at hand holding foot rubs and lots of late-night gab sessions.
sentences.chinese: 最新的消息是，你和她手牽手和多次促膝夜談。

sentences.english: There is enough room for us to form a large circle, holding hands together.
sentences.chinese: 有絕對足夠的空間讓我們圍成一個大圈，相互手牽手。

sentences.english: They went out hand in hand.
I want to give you a home, evening, walking hand in hand in the river.
sentences.chinese: 我想給你一個家，黃昏時候，手牽手散步在河邊。

sentences.english: Hand in hand, they descended the cool dark trail.
sentences.chinese: 他們手牽手，沿着一條清涼幽暗的小徑走進去。

sentences.english: Herr Li geht mit seiner Freundin liebvoll spazieren, und sogar Hand in Hand.
sentences.chinese: 李先生情意綿綿地和他的女友散步，還手牽手。

sentences.english: How good hygiene goes hand-in-hand with contact lens care.
sentences.chinese: 良好的衛生習慣如何去接觸鏡護理手牽手。

sentences.english: Afterwards we strolled hand in hand for a bit.
sentences.chinese: 之後，我們手牽手散了一小會兒步。

sentences.english: I like to walk hand in hand with my girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡跟我的女友手牽手走路。

sentences.english: They 're in the war.But only in the Olympic games,they can be standing there hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 但是隻有在奧運會上，他們才能手牽手站在一起。

sentences.english: Memories of two people hand-in-hand experience .
sentences.chinese: 兩個仌旳囙憶手牽手旳經歷。

sentences.english: Nancy was holding hands with a tall man, whom I assumed to be her husband.
sentences.chinese: 南施和一個高高的人手牽手，我推測那男人是她丈夫。

reckless/regardless of everything

to hold hands
to wander/to roam about/to loaf about/to be idle
to murmur endearments (idiom)/to get into a romantic relationship
making up a group, forming a troupe (idiom); in large numbers/as a large crowd
to dash (run fast)/to rush/to dart
